db:abstract.db:para: The QGLFunctions class provides cross-platform access to the OpenGL ES 2.0 API.

db:para.db:emphasis: This class is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.

db:abstract.db:para: This class was introduced in Qt 4.8.

db:para.db:emphasis: This class is deprecated. We strongly advise against using it in new code.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: OpenGL ES 2.0 defines a subset of the OpenGL specification that is common across many desktop and embedded OpenGL implementations. However, it can be difficult to use the functions from that subset because they need to be resolved manually on desktop systems.

QGLFunctions provides a guaranteed API that is available on all OpenGL systems and takes care of function resolution on systems that need it. The recommended way to use QGLFunctions is by direct inheritance:
The paintGL() function can then use any of the OpenGL ES 2.0 functions without explicit resolution, such as glActiveTexture() in the following example:
QGLFunctions can also be used directly for ad-hoc invocation of OpenGL ES 2.0 functions on all platforms:
QGLFunctions provides wrappers for all OpenGL ES 2.0 functions, except those like glDrawArrays(), glViewport(), and glBindTexture() that don't have portability issues.
Including the header for QGLFunctions will also define all of the OpenGL ES 2.0 macro constants that are not already defined by the system's OpenGL headers, such as GL_TEXTURE1 above.

db:section.db:title: enum QGLFunctions::OpenGLFeature
db:section.db:para: This enum defines OpenGL ES 2.0 features that may be optional on other platforms.

db:td.db:para: Vertex and index buffer functions are available.
Non power of two textures are available.

db:section.db:para: The OpenGLFeatures type is a typedef for QFlags<OpenGLFeature>. It stores an OR combination of OpenGLFeature values.

db:section.db:title: QGLFunctions::QGLFunctions()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a default function resolver. The resolver cannot be used until initializeGLFunctions() is called to specify the context.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QGLFunctions::QGLFunctions(const QGLContext *context)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a function resolver for context. If context is null, then the resolver will be created for the current QGLContext.
An object constructed in this way can only be used with context and other contexts that share with it. Use initializeGLFunctions() to change the object's context association.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QGLFunctions::~QGLFunctions()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this function resolver.

db:section.db:title: bool QGLFunctions::hasOpenGLFeature(QGLFunctions::OpenGLFeature feature) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if feature is present on this system's OpenGL implementation; false otherwise.
It is assumed that the QGLContext associated with this function resolver is current.

db:section.db:title: void QGLFunctions::initializeGLFunctions(const QGLContext *context = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Initializes GL function resolution for context. If context is null, then the current QGLContext will be used.

After calling this function, the QGLFunctions object can only be used with context and other contexts that share with it. Call initializeGLFunctions() again to change the object's context association.

db:section.db:title: QGLFunctions::OpenGLFeatures QGLFunctions::openGLFeatures() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the set of features that are present on this system's OpenGL implementation.
It is assumed that the QGLContext associated with this function resolver is current.
